headline: Egg White Breakfast Casserole
description: This egg white casserole with turkey sausage, vegetables, and Cheddar cheese can be made at the beginning of the week for a quick breakfast each morning.
name: Egg White Breakfast Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
2.5 cups cooked turkey sausage crumbles (such as Jimmy Dean®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Whisk egg whites, yogurt, salt, and pepper together in a bowl. Pour into the prepared dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until starting to set, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, saute mushrooms and onion in a pan until softened, 5 to 10 minutes. Spread mushroom mixture, sausage crumbles, and tomato over the parbaked egg layer. Cover with Cheddar cheese.
Continue baking until eggs are set and cheese is melted, 10 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: It takes a lot longer to cook than what is recommended. First initial time frame was doubled. Then after the ingredients were on top it was triple amount of time recommended. It was runny before the added time. Otherwise it was very good recipe.

This is a good basic recipe! I made some changes to it and it turned out really great: -Used BRED neopolitan pizza crust (super-thin, no sat fat); -Used about 20 ounces of organic eggwhites; -Used portobello mushrooms (sliced), Canadian bacon (diced), garlic, spinach, and onion; -Used fat free cheddar cheese. I coated a 9x13 glass pan with sunflower oil so the eggs would crust over. Submerged the pizza crust into eggs then baked as directed for 10 min. Sauted garlic, onion, mushrooms, and Canadian bacon for a few minutes, then added spinach and just sweat it; Added veggies and cheese to casserole, then increased heat to 375 degrees and baked for 15 minutes. Insert a butterknife to see if eggwhites are done. This casserole has a nice smokey flavor and the eggwhites get crusty!

I I didn’t have fresh mushrooms so used canned. Also didn’t have tomatoes. I used mozzarella cheese and Monterey Jack cheese. It needed a lot more time than was in the recipe, and will have tomatoes next time as I think it will offset the spicy crumbles.

The picture was the first thing that drew me to this recipe. Lots of color and sliced tomato over the entire casserole. The recipe calls for one chopped tomato. I used several sliced, not chopped, so it looked like the picture. Will be making this again.

Great recipe! We really enjoyed this! It was easy to make, and tasted great! I halved the recipe (used about 10 egg whites), and baked it in an 8x8" pan. It did need to bake longer than the listed time, but that could have been due to the smaller pan making the egg layer thicker than intended. I did find it to be just a bit too salty, so I would not use the added salt in the eggs next time. I used 2 sliced Roma tomatoes for the top, and that worked great. I think adding in some diced bell pepper would be a nice addition to this as well. I served it with a spinach salad and some sourdough toast for a quick and easy dinner. Thank you so much for the recipe!
